job_tasks.phrase: Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes core software engineering activities focused on building and maintaining a platform, which falls under traditional software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
job_tasks.justification: This involves evaluating and integrating new technologies into existing systems, which is a software development task, adhering to established practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
job_tasks.justification: Ensuring the resiliency and availability of products relates to the operational aspects of software systems, including reliability and uptime, which aligns with the 'Operations' aspect of MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Be a productive member of the team.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly refers to being a functional and contributing part of a team, which is a core aspect of collaboration and team productivity.

soft_skills.phrase: Be a productive member of the team.
soft_skills.justification: This phrase indicates the expectation of effective teamwork and contribution, aligning with communication and collaboration skills.

profile.rationale: The job ad focuses entirely on core software engineering tasks such as designing, building, and improving a platform, implementing new technologies, and ensuring product availability. There are no specific mentions of AI/ML model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, or any generative AI-specific technologies or tasks. The mention of 'Data & Machine Learning Engineer' in the title seems to be a misnomer given the responsibilities listed, which are purely software engineering focused.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the tasks involved, which are all within the domain of traditional software engineering. While the title mentions 'Machine Learning Engineer', the responsibilities described do not include any AI/ML specific activities, making the classification straightforward.
